information.author: Thomas ten Cate
information.description: Taekwindow is a simple, lightweight and free program that allows you to manipulate floating windows in Microsoft Windows in a way similar to many X11 window managers.

ol.li: You need to have the Microsoft .NET Framework, version 2.0 or later, installed to use the configuration tool. You can get the latest version of the framework from the Microsoft website.
To install Taekwindow, simply extract the archive to any place you like. Make sure that the files are all in the same directory.

Run taekwindowconfig.exe to configure the Taekwindow. The configuration tool can create a shortcut in the Startup section of your Start Menu, so Taekwindow is started when you log on to your computer.
Optional: create a shortcut to taekwindowconfig.exe in your Start Menu.

usage.p: Start taekwindow.exe to load the program. Nothing will seem to happen, but you can now do the following:

ul.li: Hold left Alt and drag a window with the left mouse button to move it.
Hold left Alt and drag a window with the right mouse button to resize it.

usage.p: (These buttons are configurable through the configuration tool.)
To stop the program, just run taekwindow.exe again. It will not load itself, but rather stop the running instance and then quit. You can also stop it through the Task Manager if you prefer.

configuration.p: You can configure the program using the supplied configuration tool, taekwindowconfig.exe. Its usage should be self-explanatory.
If the tool refuses to start, make sure that the .NET framework is installed. See Installation, above, for details.

bugs.p: Please see the Bugs Tracker at SourceForge.
You can view the list of bugs in the current release as well as submit any new bugs you've discovered.

feature-requests.p: Please see the Feature Requests Tracker.
Apart from a list of planned features, this also contains all feature requests submitted by users. You can of course submit your own.

version.bugfix: moving and resizing now works properly when dragging title bar or borders
moving and resizing now works on MDI child windows, instead of the parent
Taekwindow should no longer occasionally behave as if Alt is pressed when it is not

version.feature: made the modifier and mouse buttons, as well as closest-corner resizing, into options
added an option to the configuration tool for creating/deleting a Startup shortcut in the Start Menu
version.bugfix: The error message “This application has failed to start because the applicaation configuration is incorrect. Reinstalling the application may fix this problem.” no longer appears.

version.feature: moving with Alt+left button, resizing from the bottom right corner with Alt+right button
